description:
gTech’s Product and Tools Operations team (gPTO) leverages deep user, operational, and technical insights to innovate Google's Ads products into customer experiences that are so intuitive (or automated) that they require no support at all. gPTO partners closely with gTech’s Support, Professional Services, Product Management, and Engineering teams to innovate and simplify our Ads products and build the productivity tools ecosystem for gTech users.

The gTech Knowledge Infrastructure and Technology (KIT) team represents the systems needs of the gTech advertiser ecosystem (GCC, gPS, gPTO) to Product and Engineering teams. We are responsible for determining systems configuration and for building source of truth dashboarding systems in partnership with Customer Engagement (CE).

As a Global Program Manager, you will be responsible for the support of critical operational processes across the KIT team. These include managing key feature request portfolios, program management of pilots, and deployment of new systems or features. You will work cross-functionally and contribution excellent program management skills. Additionally, as part of the KIT team, you will coordinate and communicate program updates to stakeholders across gPTO, CE Engineering, and gTech stakeholder teams globally.

Google creates products and services that make the world a better place, and gTech’s role is to help bring them to life. Our teams of solution-oriented trusted advisors support millions of customers globally. Our solutions are rooted in our technical skill, product expertise, and a thorough understanding of our customers’ complex needs. Whether the answer is a bespoke solution to solve a unique problem, or a new tool that can scale across Google, everything we do aims to ensure our customers benefit from the full potential of Google products.

To learn more about gTech, check out our video.
eeo: At Google, we don’t just accept difference—we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products and our community. qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • 7 years of experience in consulting or cross-functional program management.
  • Experience utilizing analytical tools, such as spreadsheet software or SQL, for data analysis.
  • Experience in tools development, project management, and execution.
  • Experience in stakeholder management and working cross-functionally.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Experience creating financial models.
  • Experience working with technical teams.
  • Experience with online advertising products/business.
  • Excellent presentation skills, writing, and delivery.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
responsibilities:
• Design, pilot, and deploy programs for major system or feature launches.
  • Establish cadence across workstreams and clear escalation paths with executive sponsors.
  • Set clear success metrics and track progress of key team initiatives.
  • Communicate key team initiatives to stakeholders in a thoughtful and customized way.
title: Global Program Manager, Knowledge Infrastructure and Technology
